title.narrative: Women, including those in refugees/ IDPS camps and other vulnerable situations, experience enhanced safety, security, physical and mental health, and their human rights respected in conformity with ratified regional and international instruments

description.narrative: UN Women will continue to partner with local radios youth, community and religious leaders,men and boys to develop trategic advocacy and awerness programmes focusing on promoting respectful relationships and gender equality. In partnership with Ministry of Justice,UNW will support the review of the problematic 2016 GBV law. UNW will, under Output 4.2.3 , continue to strengthen multi-sectoral capacities to implement women’s rights instruments adopted by Burundi, especially CEDAW, BPA, Res 1325, in line with the NGP
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities - disaster prevention and preparedness

title.narrative: SN_DRF
Women, girls, men and boys at community level, media and community leaders are mobilized in favor of respectful relationships and gender equality for peaceful co-existence and fight against Covid 19.

description.narrative: UNW will continue to partner with local radios to develop programmes focusing on promoting respectful relationships and gender equality taking into account the pandemic context of covid-19; It will continue social mobilization with youth groups and strate

title.narrative: National and community decision-makers have the capacities and resources to enforce and account for women and girls’ human rights in line with ratified regional and international standards.

description.narrative: UNW will support the review of the problematic 2016 GBV law. After the revision, UNW will support dissemination for appropriation and implementation. It will also provide technical support through training and sharing best practices for the dissemination
